page.title: 13CUBBINGTON'S OWN CHRONICLER
page.content: Born in Cubbington in 1890, Gustavus Peppitt was very much a local man. A teacher and indeed ex headmaster of the village school, he took the greatest interest in the village, its life and its people. He had a place on the Parish Council, was a founder member of the Village Hall Trust, a member of the Cubbington Players, a trustee of Southerne's Charity and much more. His greatest love was local history. He hoarded photographs and documents, he read all of the old village records and he recorded all of the village people's doings. Finally his life's work was published as 'Reflections of Village Life from Domesday to 1970'. His book is as fascinating as it is authoritative. It is a grand memorial to a man who has been described as Cubbington's last 'Village Elder'.
